Class CvtrFile

java.lang.Object
CvtrFile
public class CvtrFile
extends java.lang.Object
The Convertator File class manages input and output of data in files. This includes configuration information and conversion values. The three data types, Units, Constants, and Equations, are stored in Convertator format file. See getCvtrFile for the description of the file format.

    • CvtrFile

      public CvtrFile() throws java.lang.Exception
      The CvtrFile constructor sets the parent class, which must provide the following Dialog(JFrame parent, String title, String message) methods:
      • infoDialog
      • errorDialog
      • yesnoDialog
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Convertator directory cannot be created in the home sub-directory.
      java.lang.Exception

  • Method Details

    • getTextFile

      public java.lang.String getTextFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      Get the text from the selected file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to read.
      Returns:
      String If there is an error, a message is saved in errorMessage and null is returned. Otherwise the data from the file is returned.

    • saveTextFile

      public boolean saveTextFile​(java.lang.String textData, java.lang.String filename)
      Save text data to a file in the user's Convertator home directory.
      Parameters:
      textData - The data to be saved.
      filename - The file where the data is to be saved.
      Returns:
      boolean True if successful. Otherwise, a message is saved in errorMessage and false is returned.

    • deleteFile

      public boolean deleteFile​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String aysMessage)
      Delete a file. The user's Convertator home directory, is checked and if not found, then the application directory is checked. If the file is found, an 'Are You Sure' message is displayed if supplied. If there is an error, the reason is saved in errorMessage for the caller to display.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file where the data is to be saved.
      aysMessage - If not null, an 'Are You Sure' message to be displayed.
      Returns:
      boolean True if successful. Otherwise, a message is saved in errorMessage and false is returned.

    • getDataFiles

      public boolean getDataFiles​(CvtrEngine ce)
      Get all Convertator data files (extension of .cvd), starting in the home directory, then in the application directory. If files in the application directory duplicate any from the home directory, a warning message is issued that they are ignored.
      Parameters:
      ce - The Convertator engine where the data is stored.
      Returns:
      boolean True if successful. If errorMessage is not null, there are warnings. Otherwise, a message is saved in errorMessage and false is returned.

    • getCvtrFile

      public CvtrData getCvtrFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      Read a Convertator format file. The format is:

      • Format flag: One octet of the form nvvvttui where:
        • n = No invert bit (always 0)
        • vvv = File format version (1 - 7)
        • tt = Type (1 = Units, 2 = Constants, 3 = Equations)
        • u = Unicode strings flag (0 = ASCII, 1 = Unicode)
        • i = Invert bit (always 1)
        If the No invert bit is 1, then the file was saved on a platform with the opposite Endian direction of the current one, and each octet in the file must be reversed.
      • Size: Four octets that contain two size values of the form eeettttt where:
        • eee = 12 bits indicating the number of elements in the file
        • ttttt = 20 bits indicating the total size of the file
      • Copyright: Two octets indicating size followed by that number of octets of text
      • Category name: One octet size value followed by that number of octets of text
      • Values: The number of elements indicated in the Size field where each element is:
        • Units: One octet size value followed by that number of octets of text, which is in the format name (abbreviation), followed the 8 octet conversion factor, where:
          • 4 octets = integer portion
          • 4 octets = fractional portion, which is divided by 2,000,000,000
        • Constants: One octet size value followed by that number of octets of text, which is in the constant name, followed the 8 octet constant value, where:
          • 4 octets = integer portion
          • 4 octets = fractional portion, which is divided by 2,000,000,000
        • Equations: One octet size value followed by that number of octets of text, which is in the constant name. The value is a one octet size value followed by that number of octets of text, which is the equation. The equation may include text placeholders, but should be syntactically correct, estpecially regarding parentheses.

      Note that all strings except copyright must have a length of less than 256 octets, which is 128 characters in Unicode. The copyright length is limited to 8192 characters by the CvtrData class.

      Parameters:
      filename - The file to be read.
      Returns:
      CvtrData If successful, the Convertator Data structure that represents the file. Otherwise, the reason is saved in errorMessage and null is returned.

    • saveCvtrFile

      public boolean saveCvtrFile​(CvtrData cData, java.lang.String filename)
      Save data to a Convertator format file. See getCvtrFile for the description of the file format. The fractional portion of Unit or Constant values is multiplied by 2,000,000,000 before saving.
      Parameters:
      cData - The data to be saved.
      filename - The filename to use.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the file is saved successfully. Otherwise the reason is saved in errorMessage and false is returned.
